intro: Daphnopsis ulei, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, pale yellow to purple flowers. The plant is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields. It has a hairy or velvety texture on its leaves, which gives it its common name. Daphnopsis ulei is also known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types and its adaptability to different environmental conditions.
